name: asemic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
using lines and symbols that look like writing, but do not have any meaning: Asemic writing is left to the reader to interpret, almost like the way in which one would deduce meaning from abstract art.
More examplesFewer examplesThe key to asemic writing is that even though it is traditionally "unreadable" it still maintains a strong attractive appeal to the reader's eye. In its most extreme form, this can lead to concrete poetry or asemic writing.An asemic text is international, and may be "read" in a similar fashion regardless of the reader's natural language.With the non specificity of asemic writing there comes a vacuum of meaning which is left for the reader to fill in and interpret.
